subsections.description: COSO Principle 1: The entity demonstrates a commitment to integrity and ethical values.

programControlMapping.name: Background checks
programControlMapping.description: Background checks are performed on newly hired employees and contractors where permitted by law.

programControlMapping.name: Disciplinary process
programControlMapping.description: Material violations of the company's Acceptable Use Policy, Code of Conduct, and Information Security policies and procedures applicable to each employee subjects the individual to disciplinary action that could include termination.

programControlMapping.name: Vendor Agreements
programControlMapping.description: Agreements with third-party services that handle Customer Sensitive data include requirements and expectations regarding data confidentiality and the vendor's security responsibilities

programControlMapping.name: Acceptable Use
programControlMapping.description: The Acceptable Use Policy outlines the acceptable use of computer equipment and systems at the company.

programControlMapping.name: Policy acknowledgement
programControlMapping.description: Company employees are required to sign and attest their adherence to applicable company policies and procedures.

programControlMapping.name: Employee Handbook / Code of Conduct
programControlMapping.description: Organizational values and behavioral standards are communicated to all personnel through an Employee Handbook, which outlines the company's policy regarding Standards of Conduct and Code of Business Ethics.

programControlMapping.name: Confidentiality agreement
programControlMapping.description: All employees and full time contractors must sign a confidentiality agreement with the company prior to gaining access to any sensitive information.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 2: The board of directors demonstrates independence from management and exercises oversight of the development and performance of internal control.

programControlMapping.name: Board Oversight
programControlMapping.description: The company leadership conducts formal reviews of the company's internal performance results with the Board of Directors.

programControlMapping.name: Board of Directors
programControlMapping.description: A Board of Directors exercises independent oversight of the company's strategic direction, operational performance, and internal control.

programControlMapping.name: Board Independence
programControlMapping.description: A majority of the Board of Directors is independent from the day to day business operations of the company.

programControlMapping.name: Board Qualifications
programControlMapping.description: Board of Directors members are actively engaged in technologies relevant to the company's primary area of operation, and possess the necessary expertise to perform oversight responsibilities.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 3: Management establishes, with board oversight, structures, reporting lines, and appropriate authorities and responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Security Officer
programControlMapping.description: Management and the Board of Directors consider requirements relevant to security, availability, processing integrity, and confidentiality. These considerations are documented in the company's Information Security Policy, which specifically delegates the overall responsibility of security to the Security Officer.

programControlMapping.name: Organizational Structure
programControlMapping.description: The company has an appropriate organizational structure based on functional departments, with an executive leader heading each department.

programControlMapping.name: Job Descriptions
programControlMapping.description: Roles and responsibilities of company employees are communicated through documented job descriptions.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 4: The entity demonstrates a commitment to attract, develop, and retain competent individuals in alignment with objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Background checks
programControlMapping.description: Background checks are performed on newly hired employees and contractors where permitted by law.

programControlMapping.name: Security Awareness Training
programControlMapping.description: Security awareness training is provided to new employees, and to all employees on a recurring annual basis, to promote strong security practices for the whole company.

programControlMapping.name: Hiring process
programControlMapping.description: The company utilizes a multistep interview process via Greenhouse to evaluate the skills, experience, and qualification of candidates before they are hired by the company.

programControlMapping.name: Training Program
programControlMapping.description: Training programs, including regular phishing tests, are in place that help employees stay current in their understanding of information security and compliance with variance laws and regulations as well as company policies.

programControlMapping.name: Employee performance reviews
programControlMapping.description: The company has established a formal review process that includes semi-annual employee self-reviews and immediate manager reviews for employees who have been with the company for at least 6 months, and a 90 day plan for new hires.

programControlMapping.name: Job Descriptions
programControlMapping.description: Roles and responsibilities of company employees are communicated through documented job descriptions.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 5: The entity holds individuals accountable for their internal control responsibilities in the pursuit of objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Board Oversight
programControlMapping.description: The company leadership conducts formal reviews of the company's internal performance results with the Board of Directors.

programControlMapping.name: Employee performance reviews
programControlMapping.description: The company has established a formal review process that includes semi-annual employee self-reviews and immediate manager reviews for employees who have been with the company for at least 6 months, and a 90 day plan for new hires.

programControlMapping.name: Organizational Strategy
programControlMapping.description: The company leadership develops and documents an organizational strategy to align internal performance goals and responsibilities with the company's business objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Company Employees Meeting
programControlMapping.description: The company leadership holds company-wide meetings to present the organizational strategy, and discuss and the alignment of internal performance goals and responsibilities with the company's business objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Disciplinary process
programControlMapping.description: Material violations of the company's Acceptable Use Policy, Code of Conduct, and Information Security policies and procedures applicable to each employee subjects the individual to disciplinary action that could include termination.

programControlMapping.name: Job Descriptions
programControlMapping.description: Roles and responsibilities of company employees are communicated through documented job descriptions.

programPolicyMapping.title: Human Resources Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the requirements for a comprehensive human resources process wherein the company attracts, develops, and retains competent and high-performing individuals capable of achieving the company's business and security objectives.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Program which protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the company's data and assets.

programPolicyMapping.title: Vendor Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the scope and objectives for the selection, acquisition, and management of products and services from third-party vendors, in order to maintain the security of the company's information assets that are accessible by those vendors

programPolicyMapping.title: Acceptable Use Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Outline the acceptable use of computer equipment and systems at the company.

programPolicyMapping.title: TrustCloud-Team Handbook
programPolicyMapping.description: This is a custom policy that represents the TrustCloud employee handbook.

programPolicyMapping.title: Employee Confidential Information and Inventions Assignment Agreement
programPolicyMapping.description: Employee Confidential Information and Inventions Assignment Agreement must be signed by new employees upon hire.

programPolicyMapping.title: Mutual Non-Disclosure Agreement
programPolicyMapping.description: Mutual Non-Disclosure Agreement Template

subsections.description: COSO Principle 13: The entity obtains or generates and uses relevant, quality information to support the functioning of internal control.

programControlMapping.name: Dependency vulnerability monitoring
programControlMapping.description: Third-party source code dependencies are continuously checked for vulnerabilities and high priority issues are tracked toward resolution.

programControlMapping.name: Security and compliance updates
programControlMapping.description: The company monitors the impact of emerging threats and technologies by subscribing to newsletters and notifications that inform about environmental, regulatory, and technological changes. The Security Officer reviews the notifications to assess potential impact to system security and compliance.

programControlMapping.name: Policy Management
programControlMapping.description: The company develops and maintains formal policies that govern information security within the company. The policies are formally reviewed and approved at least once a year, and are communicated to all employees.

programControlMapping.name: Security Event Review
programControlMapping.description: Security events are triaged and reviewed for unauthorized and malicious activity. High priority findings are treated as potential security incidents.

programControlMapping.name: Vulnerability scanning
programControlMapping.description: Vulnerability scanning tools are utilized to proactively identify CVEs across OS and applications, and issues found are resolved promptly based on severity.

programControlMapping.name: Common web vulnerabilities
programControlMapping.description: Web applications are continuously scanned and tested for common web vulnerabilities, such as OWASP top 10, and high priority issues are promptly resolved.

programControlMapping.name: Static Code Analysis
programControlMapping.description: A static code analysis tool is configured to scan the source code for vulnerabilities.

programControlMapping.name: Data classification
programControlMapping.description: All company and customer data is classified as per the data classification policy.

programControlMapping.name: Security Event Logging
programControlMapping.description: Security tools are deployed and system components are configured to monitor for security-related events.

programControlMapping.name: Compliance management tool
programControlMapping.description: The company uses TrustCloud to continuously monitor key company systems for compliance adherence, highlight gaps in internal controls, and identify risks.

programControlMapping.name: Pen testing
programControlMapping.description: Third-party vendors are used to perform penetration tests against the production system on an annual basis. Identified Critical and High issues are promptly resolved and the rest are prioritized as appropriate.

programControlMapping.name: Information Security Policy
programControlMapping.description: A documented Information Security Program exist to protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the company's data and assets.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 14: The entity internally communicates information, including objectives and responsibilities for internal control, necessary to support the functioning of internal control.

programControlMapping.name: Organizational Strategy
programControlMapping.description: The company leadership develops and documents an organizational strategy to align internal performance goals and responsibilities with the company's business objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Security Awareness Training
programControlMapping.description: Security awareness training is provided to new employees, and to all employees on a recurring annual basis, to promote strong security practices for the whole company.

programControlMapping.name: Customer Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: A customer risk register is in place to track customer related risks and help prevent churn risks. The register is reviewed monthly and treatment plans are tracked to resolution.

programControlMapping.name: Policy Management
programControlMapping.description: The company develops and maintains formal policies that govern information security within the company. The policies are formally reviewed and approved at least once a year, and are communicated to all employees.

programControlMapping.name: Job Descriptions
programControlMapping.description: Roles and responsibilities of company employees are communicated through documented job descriptions.

programControlMapping.name: Internal Support Channel
programControlMapping.description: Employees have access to an internal support channel that can be used to report incidents, concerns, and complaints.

programControlMapping.name: Company Employees Meeting
programControlMapping.description: The company leadership holds company-wide meetings to present the organizational strategy, and discuss and the alignment of internal performance goals and responsibilities with the company's business objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Training Program
programControlMapping.description: Training programs, including regular phishing tests, are in place that help employees stay current in their understanding of information security and compliance with variance laws and regulations as well as company policies.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 15: The entity communicates with external parties regarding matters affecting the functioning of internal control.

programControlMapping.name: Vendor Agreements
programControlMapping.description: Agreements with third-party services that handle Customer Sensitive data include requirements and expectations regarding data confidentiality and the vendor's security responsibilities

programControlMapping.name: Privacy Policy
programControlMapping.description: The company's Privacy Policy is available online to visitors and customers, and outlines the receipt, sharing, use, and disposal of visitor and subscriber data.

programControlMapping.name: Support channel
programControlMapping.description: External users are provided with a support channel for reporting systems failures, incidents, concerns, and other complaints to appropriate personnel.

programControlMapping.name: Customer Support SLA
programControlMapping.description: A support SLA is maintained to ensure that customer inquiries are addressed timely. Metrics are compiled and shared internally.

programControlMapping.name: Documentation site
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a customer-accessible technical documentation site containing high-level overviews and detailed information about the company's products and services, including security-oriented articles and guides.

programControlMapping.name: Customer Engagement
programControlMapping.description: The customer success team engages with paying customers at least once a month via communication channels including, but, not limited to calls, slacks or -emails.

programControlMapping.name: Master Services Agreement
programControlMapping.description: The company's Master Services Agreement with its customers communicates the responsibilities of both parties relative to internal controls impacting Security, Availability, Processing Integrity and Confidentiality.

programControlMapping.name: Terms of Use
programControlMapping.description: The company's Terms of Use are available online to visitors and customers, and outline the requirements and commitments of both parties relative to security and confidentiality.

programControlMapping.name: System status
programControlMapping.description: The company has established a channel and procedure for communicating system status to its users and customers, including uptime, performance issues, and security concerns.

programControlMapping.name: Release Notifications
programControlMapping.description: The company communicates system changes to its users and customers through an established channel and procedure.

programPolicyMapping.title: Vulnerability Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish vulnerability management controls and provide guidelines for their implementation.

programPolicyMapping.title: Human Resources Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the requirements for a comprehensive human resources process wherein the company attracts, develops, and retains competent and high-performing individuals capable of achieving the company's business and security objectives.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Program which protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the company's data and assets.

programPolicyMapping.title: Vendor Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the scope and objectives for the selection, acquisition, and management of products and services from third-party vendors, in order to maintain the security of the company's information assets that are accessible by those vendors

programPolicyMapping.title: Audit Logging Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Outline how systems generate log events for audit purposes, and how these logs are stored and processed to help detect security issues.

programPolicyMapping.title: Data Classification Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Define a data classification framework that can be used to determine the sensitivity of data and systems.

programPolicyMapping.title: Open Source Software Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Govern the usage of Open Source Software at the company.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 6: The entity specifies objectives with sufficient clarity to enable the identification and assessment of risks relating to objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a risk management program to identify, prioritize, and mitigate risk to acceptable levels.

programControlMapping.name: Company Employees Meeting
programControlMapping.description: The company leadership holds company-wide meetings to present the organizational strategy, and discuss and the alignment of internal performance goals and responsibilities with the company's business objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Organizational Strategy
programControlMapping.description: The company leadership develops and documents an organizational strategy to align internal performance goals and responsibilities with the company's business objectives.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 7: The entity identifies risks to the achievement of its objectives across the entity and analyzes risks as a basis for determining how the risks should be managed.

programControlMapping.name: Pen testing
programControlMapping.description: Third-party vendors are used to perform penetration tests against the production system on an annual basis. Identified Critical and High issues are promptly resolved and the rest are prioritized as appropriate.

programControlMapping.name: Vulnerability scanning
programControlMapping.description: Vulnerability scanning tools are utilized to proactively identify CVEs across OS and applications, and issues found are resolved promptly based on severity.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

programControlMapping.name: Inventory
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains an inventory of IT infrastructure devices.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 8: The entity considers the potential for fraud in assessing risks to the achievement of objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Fraud Risk
programControlMapping.description: The company assesses the potential for fraud from internal or external stakeholders as part of its Risk Assessment process.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 9: The entity identifies and assesses changes that could significantly impact the system of internal control.

programControlMapping.name: Vendor Monitoring
programControlMapping.description: Vendors are evaluated on a periodic basis, by reviewing their audit reports or other means, in order to track and determine the impact of any changes in their security posture.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

programControlMapping.name: Security and compliance updates
programControlMapping.description: The company monitors the impact of emerging threats and technologies by subscribing to newsletters and notifications that inform about environmental, regulatory, and technological changes. The Security Officer reviews the notifications to assess potential impact to system security and compliance.

programPolicyMapping.title: Vulnerability Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish vulnerability management controls and provide guidelines for their implementation.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Program which protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the company's data and assets.

programPolicyMapping.title: Vendor Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the scope and objectives for the selection, acquisition, and management of products and services from third-party vendors, in order to maintain the security of the company's information assets that are accessible by those vendors

programPolicyMapping.title: Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish a framework for managing risk at the company and incorporating risk assessments throughout the company's operations.

programPolicyMapping.title: Asset Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Outline guidelines and practices to protect IT assets used to access sensitive customer or company data, and ensure any such access maintains the security and confidentiality of the data.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 16: The entity selects, develops, and performs ongoing and/or separate evaluations to ascertain whether the components of internal control are present and functioning.

programControlMapping.name: Common web vulnerabilities
programControlMapping.description: Web applications are continuously scanned and tested for common web vulnerabilities, such as OWASP top 10, and high priority issues are promptly resolved.

programControlMapping.name: Dependency vulnerability monitoring
programControlMapping.description: Third-party source code dependencies are continuously checked for vulnerabilities and high priority issues are tracked toward resolution.

programControlMapping.name: Capacity Planning
programControlMapping.description: The company performs capacity planning to ensure that sufficient capacity is available to handle the forecasted demand and workloads of its customers.

programControlMapping.name: Static Code Analysis
programControlMapping.description: A static code analysis tool is configured to scan the source code for vulnerabilities.

programControlMapping.name: Responsible Disclosure
programControlMapping.description: The company offers a responsible disclosure mechanism for safely reporting security vulnerabilities.

programControlMapping.name: Board Oversight
programControlMapping.description: The company leadership conducts formal reviews of the company's internal performance results with the Board of Directors.

programControlMapping.name: Security Event Review
programControlMapping.description: Security events are triaged and reviewed for unauthorized and malicious activity. High priority findings are treated as potential security incidents.

programControlMapping.name: Internal Assessments
programControlMapping.description: The company performs internal assessments to validate the functioning of its compliance controls. The results of the assessments are documented and reviewed by the company leadership.

programControlMapping.name: Performance monitoring
programControlMapping.description: The company uses performance monitoring tools to track the performance of its applications and identify potential issues.

programControlMapping.name: Pen testing
programControlMapping.description: Third-party vendors are used to perform penetration tests against the production system on an annual basis. Identified Critical and High issues are promptly resolved and the rest are prioritized as appropriate.

programControlMapping.name: Vulnerability scanning
programControlMapping.description: Vulnerability scanning tools are utilized to proactively identify CVEs across OS and applications, and issues found are resolved promptly based on severity.

programControlMapping.name: Security Event Logging
programControlMapping.description: Security tools are deployed and system components are configured to monitor for security-related events.

programControlMapping.name: Data Retention and Disposal Policy
programControlMapping.description: A documented Data Retention and Disposal policy exists that defines the requirements for retention and eventual disposal of data, in order to ensure the confidentiality of sensitive company and customer information.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 17: The entity evaluates and communicates internal control deficiencies in a timely manner to those parties responsible for taking corrective action, including senior management and the board of directors, as appropriate.

programControlMapping.name: External Assessments
programControlMapping.description: The company commissions external third-party assessments to validate its compliance controls. Assessment results are documented and reviewed by company leadership

programControlMapping.name: Board Oversight
programControlMapping.description: The company leadership conducts formal reviews of the company's internal performance results with the Board of Directors.

programControlMapping.name: Capacity Planning
programControlMapping.description: The company performs capacity planning to ensure that sufficient capacity is available to handle the forecasted demand and workloads of its customers.

programPolicyMapping.title: Vulnerability Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish vulnerability management controls and provide guidelines for their implementation.

programPolicyMapping.title: Change Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Provide guidance on the process of managing change across company critical systems and products.

programPolicyMapping.title: Data Retention and Disposal Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish requirements surrounding the retention and eventual disposal of data, in order to ensure confidentiality of sensitive company and customer information.

programPolicyMapping.title: Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish a framework for managing risk at the company and incorporating risk assessments throughout the company's operations.

programPolicyMapping.title: Audit Logging Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Outline how systems generate log events for audit purposes, and how these logs are stored and processed to help detect security issues.

programPolicyMapping.title: Internal Audit Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Define the objectives, authority, and responsibilities of the Internal Audit role within the company.

programPolicyMapping.title: Open Source Software Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Govern the usage of Open Source Software at the company.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 10: The entity selects and develops control activities that contribute to the mitigation of risks to the achievement of objectives to acceptable levels.

programControlMapping.name: Control reviews
programControlMapping.description: Management periodically reviews control activities to reaffirm each control's relevance, and updates the set of controls as necessary.

programControlMapping.name: Control selection
programControlMapping.description: The company designs and implements controls to mitigate risks identified during the risk assessment process.

programControlMapping.name: Policy Management
programControlMapping.description: The company develops and maintains formal policies that govern information security within the company. The policies are formally reviewed and approved at least once a year, and are communicated to all employees.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 11: The entity also selects and develops general control activities over technology to support the achievement of objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Technology control
programControlMapping.description: Control activities over the technology infrastructure and technology access control are designed and implemented to help ensure the completeness, accuracy, and availability of technology processing.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

programControlMapping.name: Control selection
programControlMapping.description: The company designs and implements controls to mitigate risks identified during the risk assessment process.

programControlMapping.name: Control reviews
programControlMapping.description: Management periodically reviews control activities to reaffirm each control's relevance, and updates the set of controls as necessary.

subsections.description: COSO Principle 12: The entity deploys control activities through policies that establish what is expected and in procedures that put policies into action.

programControlMapping.name: Corrective actions
programControlMapping.description: Control owners take corrective actions when issues and nonconformities with their controls are identified.

programControlMapping.name: Disciplinary process
programControlMapping.description: Material violations of the company's Acceptable Use Policy, Code of Conduct, and Information Security policies and procedures applicable to each employee subjects the individual to disciplinary action that could include termination.

programControlMapping.name: Policy Management
programControlMapping.description: The company develops and maintains formal policies that govern information security within the company. The policies are formally reviewed and approved at least once a year, and are communicated to all employees.

programControlMapping.name: Information Security Policy
programControlMapping.description: A documented Information Security Program exist to protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the company's data and assets.

programControlMapping.name: Procedure creation
programControlMapping.description: The company establishes procedures that put its policies into action.

programControlMapping.name: Data classification
programControlMapping.description: All company and customer data is classified as per the data classification policy.

programPolicyMapping.title: Human Resources Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the requirements for a comprehensive human resources process wherein the company attracts, develops, and retains competent and high-performing individuals capable of achieving the company's business and security objectives.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Program which protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the company's data and assets.

programPolicyMapping.title: Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish a framework for managing risk at the company and incorporating risk assessments throughout the company's operations.

programPolicyMapping.title: Data Classification Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Define a data classification framework that can be used to determine the sensitivity of data and systems.

subsections.description: The entity implements logical access security software, infrastructure, and architectures over protected information assets to protect them from security events to meet the entity's objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Product Security Controls
programControlMapping.description: The product provides the necessary means (such as authentication and access control) for customers to ensure the security and confidentiality of their data. A guide to the customer's responsibilities and overall security best practices is available as public documentation.

programControlMapping.name: Inventory
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains an inventory of IT infrastructure devices.

programControlMapping.name: Privileged Access Management
programControlMapping.description: A privileged access management tool is in place to manage and control the authentication to production systems.

programControlMapping.name: Password management tool
programControlMapping.description: All users with privileged access to sensitive systems are required to use a password management solution.

programControlMapping.name: Administrative access
programControlMapping.description: Administrative access privileges for sensitive systems are only granted to a restricted, small set of personnel, with a clearly defined business need to maintain and administer those systems.

programControlMapping.name: Least-privilege access
programControlMapping.description: Access to sensitive systems and resources is granted based on the principle of least privilege.

programControlMapping.name: Host hardening
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a host hardening policy for VMs and containers that describes the baseline security standard for hosts. The policy is expressed as code and playbooks, and all new hosts are built using it.

programControlMapping.name: Cryptography
programControlMapping.description: The company uses widely-adopted implementations of industry standard algorithms and appropriate key lengths for all cryptography-related operations.

programControlMapping.name: Password Configurations
programControlMapping.description: Password configuration settings are managed in compliance with the company's Password Policy.

programControlMapping.name: Asset types
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a hardening checklist for each IT Infrastructure device type (workstation/OS).

programControlMapping.name: System Inventory
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains an inventory of all information systems, services, and assets, and classifies them based on the data they store. Inventory is reviewed as part of an annual Risk Assessment.

programControlMapping.name: Encryption Documentation
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains documented guidance on the selection and configuration of appropriate cryptographic methods.

programControlMapping.name: Single sign-on (SSO)
programControlMapping.description: The company leverages SSO authentication for sensitive systems, wherever available.

programControlMapping.name: Multi-factor authentication (MFA)
programControlMapping.description: Access to sensitive systems requires multi-factor authentication.

programControlMapping.name: Role-based access control
programControlMapping.description: Defined permission roles are utilized to assign and segregate access privileges to data and systems.

programControlMapping.name: Information Security Policy
programControlMapping.description: A documented Information Security Program exist to protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the company's data and assets.

subsections.description: Prior to issuing system credentials and granting system access, the entity registers and authorizes new internal and external users whose access is administered by the entity. For those users whose access is administered by the entity, user system credentials are removed when user access is no longer authorized.

programControlMapping.name: User Access Review
programControlMapping.description: User access privileges are periodically reviewed to ensure that access to data is restricted and authorized. Accounts identified as inappropriate are investigated and resolved.

programControlMapping.name: Requesting and approving access
programControlMapping.description: Access to systems is requested by filing an internal access request ticket specifying the need for the access. Access is approved by the respective manager and granted by administrators based on a least-privilege principle.

programControlMapping.name: Least-privilege access
programControlMapping.description: Access to sensitive systems and resources is granted based on the principle of least privilege.

programControlMapping.name: Password Configurations
programControlMapping.description: Password configuration settings are managed in compliance with the company's Password Policy.

programControlMapping.name: Customer Confidential Systems Access Review
programControlMapping.description: A review of users with access to Customer Confidential systems is performed periodically to ensure that access is restricted to appropriate personnel.

programControlMapping.name: Privileged Access Management
programControlMapping.description: A privileged access management tool is in place to manage and control the authentication to production systems.

programControlMapping.name: Termination process
programControlMapping.description: Termination checklists are executed upon separation with an employee or contractor to ensure asset return, and prompt and complete access revocation.

subsections.description: The entity authorizes, modifies, or removes access to data, software, functions, and other protected information assets based on roles, responsibilities, or the system design and changes, giving consideration to the concepts of least privilege and segregation of duties, to meet the entity’s objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Administrative access
programControlMapping.description: Administrative access privileges for sensitive systems are only granted to a restricted, small set of personnel, with a clearly defined business need to maintain and administer those systems.

programControlMapping.name: Password Configurations
programControlMapping.description: Password configuration settings are managed in compliance with the company's Password Policy.

programControlMapping.name: Customer Confidential Systems Access Review
programControlMapping.description: A review of users with access to Customer Confidential systems is performed periodically to ensure that access is restricted to appropriate personnel.

programControlMapping.name: Termination process
programControlMapping.description: Termination checklists are executed upon separation with an employee or contractor to ensure asset return, and prompt and complete access revocation.

programControlMapping.name: User Access Review
programControlMapping.description: User access privileges are periodically reviewed to ensure that access to data is restricted and authorized. Accounts identified as inappropriate are investigated and resolved.

programControlMapping.name: Role-based access control
programControlMapping.description: Defined permission roles are utilized to assign and segregate access privileges to data and systems.

programControlMapping.name: Requesting and approving access
programControlMapping.description: Access to systems is requested by filing an internal access request ticket specifying the need for the access. Access is approved by the respective manager and granted by administrators based on a least-privilege principle.

programControlMapping.name: Privileged Access Management
programControlMapping.description: A privileged access management tool is in place to manage and control the authentication to production systems.

subsections.description: The entity restricts physical access to facilities and protected information assets (for example, data center facilities,  back-up media storage, and other sensitive locations) to authorized personnel to meet the entity’s objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Equipment room
programControlMapping.description: Access to the corporate equipment room is restricted to authorized individuals logically and physically at all times.

programControlMapping.name: Office access
programControlMapping.description: Access to corporate facilities is controlled via a secure keycard or badge system. Access is promptly revoked upon employee termination or transfer, and is reviewed on a regular basis.

programControlMapping.name: Backup Plan
programControlMapping.description: Customer data is automatically backed up according to a backup configuration scheduled described in the Backup Procedure.

programControlMapping.name: Visitor access
programControlMapping.description: Guests are not permitted to walk through the premises unattended and do not have access to any corporate facilities.

subsections.description: The entity discontinues logical and physical protections over physical assets only after the ability to read or recover data and software from those assets has been diminished and is no longer required to meet the entity’s objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Data Retention and Disposal Policy
programControlMapping.description: A documented Data Retention and Disposal policy exists that defines the requirements for retention and eventual disposal of data, in order to ensure the confidentiality of sensitive company and customer information.

programControlMapping.name: Data Disposal
programControlMapping.description: Customer data is securely disposed of after its retention period passes, and any retained data is sanitized and anonymized.

programControlMapping.name: Asset Disposal
programControlMapping.description: A process is in place to track and properly dispose of IT assets that have reached their end of life.

programControlMapping.name: Data Retention
programControlMapping.description: Retention periods for customer data are specified in the company's Data Retention Procedure and adhere to compliance, regulatory, contractual, and organizational requirements.

subsections.description: The entity implements logical access security measures to protect against threats from sources outside its system boundaries.

programControlMapping.name: VPN
programControlMapping.description: The backend production environment has only private network interfaces, and is only accessible via secure communication mechanisms, such as VPN tunnels or SSH through Bastion hosts.

programControlMapping.name: Firewall Ruleset Review
programControlMapping.description: Firewall rulesets are periodically reviewed to ensure that only necessary ports are open.

programControlMapping.name: Vulnerability scanning
programControlMapping.description: Vulnerability scanning tools are utilized to proactively identify CVEs across OS and applications, and issues found are resolved promptly based on severity.

programControlMapping.name: Web Application Firewall
programControlMapping.description: A Web Application Firewall is employed to protect critical web endpoints by filtering common web-based exploits.

programControlMapping.name: Pen testing
programControlMapping.description: Third-party vendors are used to perform penetration tests against the production system on an annual basis. Identified Critical and High issues are promptly resolved and the rest are prioritized as appropriate.

programControlMapping.name: Encryption Documentation
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains documented guidance on the selection and configuration of appropriate cryptographic methods.

programControlMapping.name: Intrusion detection
programControlMapping.description: A network-based Intrusion Detection System is employed to analyze and report on network events, detect potentially compromised instances, and send alerts for high-severity threats.

programControlMapping.name: Key management
programControlMapping.description: When made available by the cloud provider, prefer using provider-supplied keys and trusted key management system (KMS) over self-managed keys.

programControlMapping.name: TLS certificates and endpoints
programControlMapping.description: TLS usage is evaluated on a quarterly basis using tools such as ssllabs and any grades lower than A are promptly corrected.

programControlMapping.name: Firewalls
programControlMapping.description: Firewalls are configured to restrict network traffic to the minimum required for the system to function.

subsections.description: The entity restricts the transmission, movement, and removal of information to authorized internal and external users and processes, and protects it during transmission, movement, or removal to meet the entity’s objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Data store encryption
programControlMapping.description: Data stores are configured to enable encryption at rest.

programControlMapping.name: Intrusion detection
programControlMapping.description: A network-based Intrusion Detection System is employed to analyze and report on network events, detect potentially compromised instances, and send alerts for high-severity threats.

programControlMapping.name: Data Loss Prevention
programControlMapping.description: A data loss prevention tool is in place to monitor and block sensitive information from leaving its secure environment.

programControlMapping.name: VPN
programControlMapping.description: The backend production environment has only private network interfaces, and is only accessible via secure communication mechanisms, such as VPN tunnels or SSH through Bastion hosts.

programControlMapping.name: Bring Your Own Device (BYOD) Policy
programControlMapping.description: A "bring your own device" policy is in place to guide employees on the acceptable use of their personal electronic devices for work purposes.

programControlMapping.name: Data in transit encryption
programControlMapping.description: Data in transit over the public Internet is encrypted with industry-standard algorithms.

programControlMapping.name: Web Application Firewall
programControlMapping.description: A Web Application Firewall is employed to protect critical web endpoints by filtering common web-based exploits.

programControlMapping.name: File store encryption
programControlMapping.description: Third-party cloud filestores such as S3 and GCS are configured with a minimum server-side encryption using the vendor's key.

programControlMapping.name: Encryption Documentation
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains documented guidance on the selection and configuration of appropriate cryptographic methods.

programControlMapping.name: TLS certificates and endpoints
programControlMapping.description: TLS usage is evaluated on a quarterly basis using tools such as ssllabs and any grades lower than A are promptly corrected.

programControlMapping.name: File systems encryption
programControlMapping.description: File systems for databases and other sensitive data storage require at least block level encryption.

programControlMapping.name: Mobile Device Management
programControlMapping.description: A device management tool is configured to manage and encrypt employee mobile devices.

programControlMapping.name: Firewalls
programControlMapping.description: Firewalls are configured to restrict network traffic to the minimum required for the system to function.

subsections.description: The entity implements controls to prevent or detect and act upon the introduction of unauthorized or malicious software to meet the entity’s objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Asset types
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a hardening checklist for each IT Infrastructure device type (workstation/OS).

programControlMapping.name: Removable media
programControlMapping.description: Storing sensitive customer data on removable media is prohibited.

programControlMapping.name: Workstations - malware
programControlMapping.description: Workstations with OS that require anti-virus and malware protection are being monitored for compliance with the policy.

programControlMapping.name: Patch Management
programControlMapping.description: Software patching are applied at as needed.

programControlMapping.name: Workstations - OS
programControlMapping.description: The company monitors the IT infrastructure devices for compliance with the Asset Management Policy and checks for requirements such as hard drive encryption, user authentication requirements, and security patching.

programControlMapping.name: Production Change Notifications
programControlMapping.description: Production changes automatically trigger a notification sent to designated personnel.

programControlMapping.name: Acceptable Use
programControlMapping.description: The Acceptable Use Policy outlines the acceptable use of computer equipment and systems at the company.

programControlMapping.name: Malware detection
programControlMapping.description: Anti-malware or anti-virus software is used on applicable server environments to detect and remediate malware.

programPolicyMapping.title: Backup Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Describe controls that are necessary to mitigate the accidental loss of data by maintaining backups.

programPolicyMapping.title: Vulnerability Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish vulnerability management controls and provide guidelines for their implementation.

programPolicyMapping.title: Encryption Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish practices for protecting your company data in the event of unauthorized access through the use of encryption.

programPolicyMapping.title: Authentication and Password Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Describe requirements with regards to account authentication, including how passwords should be generated, used, and protected.

programPolicyMapping.title: Access Control Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the principles and guidelines for controlling access to company systems.

programPolicyMapping.title: Data Retention and Disposal Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish requirements surrounding the retention and eventual disposal of data, in order to ensure confidentiality of sensitive company and customer information.

programPolicyMapping.title: Human Resources Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the requirements for a comprehensive human resources process wherein the company attracts, develops, and retains competent and high-performing individuals capable of achieving the company's business and security objectives.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Program which protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the company's data and assets.

programPolicyMapping.title: Asset Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Outline guidelines and practices to protect IT assets used to access sensitive customer or company data, and ensure any such access maintains the security and confidentiality of the data.

programPolicyMapping.title: Physical Security Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the requirements and process for controlling access to company facilities and requirements for data centers hosting company system components.

programPolicyMapping.title: Acceptable Use Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Outline the acceptable use of computer equipment and systems at the company.

programPolicyMapping.title: Data Classification Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Define a data classification framework that can be used to determine the sensitivity of data and systems.

programPolicyMapping.title: Remote Access Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: The purpose of this policy is to establish security controls and requirements to ensure that remote access to TrustCloud systems and data is performed securely, mitigating risks to sensitive customer and company information.

subsections.description: To meet its objectives, the entity uses detection and monitoring procedures to identify (1) changes to configurations that result in the introduction of new vulnerabilities, and (2) susceptibilities to newly discovered vulnerabilities.

programControlMapping.name: Audit Logging
programControlMapping.description: All sensitive systems generate audit logs to capture actions taken by users.

programControlMapping.name: Pen testing
programControlMapping.description: Third-party vendors are used to perform penetration tests against the production system on an annual basis. Identified Critical and High issues are promptly resolved and the rest are prioritized as appropriate.

programControlMapping.name: Responsible Disclosure
programControlMapping.description: The company offers a responsible disclosure mechanism for safely reporting security vulnerabilities.

programControlMapping.name: Common web vulnerabilities
programControlMapping.description: Web applications are continuously scanned and tested for common web vulnerabilities, such as OWASP top 10, and high priority issues are promptly resolved.

programControlMapping.name: Host hardening
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a host hardening policy for VMs and containers that describes the baseline security standard for hosts. The policy is expressed as code and playbooks, and all new hosts are built using it.

programControlMapping.name: Dependency vulnerability monitoring
programControlMapping.description: Third-party source code dependencies are continuously checked for vulnerabilities and high priority issues are tracked toward resolution.

programControlMapping.name: Static Code Analysis
programControlMapping.description: A static code analysis tool is configured to scan the source code for vulnerabilities.

programControlMapping.name: Firewall Ruleset Review
programControlMapping.description: Firewall rulesets are periodically reviewed to ensure that only necessary ports are open.

programControlMapping.name: Vulnerability scanning
programControlMapping.description: Vulnerability scanning tools are utilized to proactively identify CVEs across OS and applications, and issues found are resolved promptly based on severity.

subsections.description: The entity monitors system components and the operation of those components for anomalies that are indicative of malicious acts, natural disasters, and errors affecting the entity's ability to meet its objectives; anomalies are analyzed to determine whether they represent security events.

programControlMapping.name: Security Event Review
programControlMapping.description: Security events are triaged and reviewed for unauthorized and malicious activity. High priority findings are treated as potential security incidents.

programControlMapping.name: Vulnerability scanning
programControlMapping.description: Vulnerability scanning tools are utilized to proactively identify CVEs across OS and applications, and issues found are resolved promptly based on severity.

programControlMapping.name: Static Code Analysis
programControlMapping.description: A static code analysis tool is configured to scan the source code for vulnerabilities.

programControlMapping.name: Intrusion detection
programControlMapping.description: A network-based Intrusion Detection System is employed to analyze and report on network events, detect potentially compromised instances, and send alerts for high-severity threats.

programControlMapping.name: Backup Plan
programControlMapping.description: Customer data is automatically backed up according to a backup configuration scheduled described in the Backup Procedure.

programControlMapping.name: Dependency vulnerability monitoring
programControlMapping.description: Third-party source code dependencies are continuously checked for vulnerabilities and high priority issues are tracked toward resolution.

programControlMapping.name: Centralized Logging
programControlMapping.description: Applications and system logs are pushed to a central logging repository where possible. Access control to the central repository is enforced based on the Access Control policy. Logs are retained in compliance with applicable legal, regulatory, customer, and operational requirements.

programControlMapping.name: Security Event Logging
programControlMapping.description: Security tools are deployed and system components are configured to monitor for security-related events.

programControlMapping.name: Common web vulnerabilities
programControlMapping.description: Web applications are continuously scanned and tested for common web vulnerabilities, such as OWASP top 10, and high priority issues are promptly resolved.

programControlMapping.name: Audit Logging
programControlMapping.description: All sensitive systems generate audit logs to capture actions taken by users.

programControlMapping.name: Pen testing
programControlMapping.description: Third-party vendors are used to perform penetration tests against the production system on an annual basis. Identified Critical and High issues are promptly resolved and the rest are prioritized as appropriate.

programControlMapping.name: Logging of Administrative actions
programControlMapping.description: Logs from privileged administrative actions on sensitive systems are stored in a separate location with a very restricted access control.

subsections.description: The entity evaluates security events to determine whether they could or have resulted in a failure of the entity to meet its objectives (security incidents) and, if so, takes actions to prevent or address such failures.

programControlMapping.name: Security Incident - Testing
programControlMapping.description: The Security Incident process is tested at least once a year if an actual incident has not occurred.

programControlMapping.name: Security Incident Management Program
programControlMapping.description: The Incident Management Program outlines the requirements and process for declaring and responding to incidents, including the roles and responsibilities, and the internal and external communication necessary to take the issue to resolution.

programControlMapping.name: Security Incident - Change Management
programControlMapping.description: Incidents requiring persistent changes to the system follow the standard change management process.

programControlMapping.name: Security Team Meetings
programControlMapping.description: The company's Security Team meets regularly to discuss security-related goals that advance the company's business objectives, and plan for the resolution or mitigation of current security risks and incidents.

programControlMapping.name: Security Incident - Tracking
programControlMapping.description: Incidents are recorded and tracked, and all applicable evidence and documentation is reviewed in post-mortem meetings.

subsections.description: The entity responds to identified security incidents by executing a defined incident response program to understand, contain, remediate, and communicate security incidents, as appropriate.

programControlMapping.name: Security Incident Management Program
programControlMapping.description: The Incident Management Program outlines the requirements and process for declaring and responding to incidents, including the roles and responsibilities, and the internal and external communication necessary to take the issue to resolution.

programControlMapping.name: Security Incident - Tracking
programControlMapping.description: Incidents are recorded and tracked, and all applicable evidence and documentation is reviewed in post-mortem meetings.

subsections.description: The entity identifies, develops, and implements activities to recover from identified security incidents.

programControlMapping.name: Security Incident - Tracking
programControlMapping.description: Incidents are recorded and tracked, and all applicable evidence and documentation is reviewed in post-mortem meetings.

programControlMapping.name: Security Team Meetings
programControlMapping.description: The company's Security Team meets regularly to discuss security-related goals that advance the company's business objectives, and plan for the resolution or mitigation of current security risks and incidents.

programControlMapping.name: Security Incident Management Program
programControlMapping.description: The Incident Management Program outlines the requirements and process for declaring and responding to incidents, including the roles and responsibilities, and the internal and external communication necessary to take the issue to resolution.

programControlMapping.name: Security Incident - Testing
programControlMapping.description: The Security Incident process is tested at least once a year if an actual incident has not occurred.

programControlMapping.name: Security Incident - Change Management
programControlMapping.description: Incidents requiring persistent changes to the system follow the standard change management process.

programControlMapping.name: Patch Management
programControlMapping.description: Software patching are applied at as needed.

programPolicyMapping.title: Security Incident Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish requirements and plans for reporting and responding to security incidents impacting corporate or customer systems.

programPolicyMapping.title: Backup Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Describe controls that are necessary to mitigate the accidental loss of data by maintaining backups.

programPolicyMapping.title: Vulnerability Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish vulnerability management controls and provide guidelines for their implementation.

programPolicyMapping.title: Audit Logging Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Outline how systems generate log events for audit purposes, and how these logs are stored and processed to help detect security issues.

programPolicyMapping.title: Open Source Software Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Govern the usage of Open Source Software at the company.

subsections.description: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, configures, documents, tests, approves, and implements changes to infrastructure, data, software, and procedures to meet its objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Production Deployment Access
programControlMapping.description: The ability to deploy application changes to production environments is restricted to authorized personnel.

programControlMapping.name: Infrastructure-as-code
programControlMapping.description: All infrastructure is managed as code and follows the standard code review process including approvals and automated testing.

programControlMapping.name: Change Management - Tracking
programControlMapping.description: Changes are tracked and documented in the source code management system and their business purpose is defined in the project management tool.

programControlMapping.name: Emergency Changes
programControlMapping.description: Emergency changes follow the standard change management process, at an accelerated timeline.

programControlMapping.name: SDLC - Security Reviews
programControlMapping.description: Major product changes and new features undergo specialized security reviews and risk assessment by qualified personnel early in the design phase, and as required throughout implementation.

programControlMapping.name: Source Control
programControlMapping.description: The company uses a version control system to manage source code and documentation, and to implement and run change management functions. The version control software is only accessible by authorized personnel.

programControlMapping.name: Backup Plan
programControlMapping.description: Customer data is automatically backed up according to a backup configuration scheduled described in the Backup Procedure.

programControlMapping.name: UX Design Review
programControlMapping.description: UX approval is required for any feature that is accessed by end-users. This is provided through UX QA on the implementation in GitHub prior to release.

programControlMapping.name: Agile Process
programControlMapping.description: The company's software development process includes frequent team meetings which facilitate the communication and evaluation of objectives between team members. These touch points include planning meetings, regular standups, and retrospective meetings.

programControlMapping.name: Quality control process
programControlMapping.description: The company performs continuous Quality Control as part of the overall development process. The process leverages a variety of automated testing practices and is documented internally.

programControlMapping.name: Patch Management
programControlMapping.description: Software patching are applied at as needed.

programControlMapping.name: Change Management Workflow
programControlMapping.description: The Change Management documentation outlines the internal workflow for propagating application and infrastructure code changes to the production environment, including tracking, testing, reviewing and approving.

programControlMapping.name: Change Management Tooling
programControlMapping.description: Change Management procedures are expressed, as much as possible, in appropriate configuration of Continuous Integrations / Continuous Deployment tools, in order to minimize human error and increase auditability of the changes.

programControlMapping.name: Change Management Approvals
programControlMapping.description: All application and infrastructure changes are reviewed by a separate technical resource and approved by authorized personnel before being delivered to the production environment.

programControlMapping.name: SDLC - Separation of environments
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains separate production and non-production environments.

programControlMapping.name: Production Change Notifications
programControlMapping.description: Production changes automatically trigger a notification sent to designated personnel.

programPolicyMapping.title: Backup Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Describe controls that are necessary to mitigate the accidental loss of data by maintaining backups.

programPolicyMapping.title: Vulnerability Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish vulnerability management controls and provide guidelines for their implementation.

programPolicyMapping.title: Change Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Provide guidance on the process of managing change across company critical systems and products.

programPolicyMapping.title: Software Development Lifecycle Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Software Development Lifecycle Policy

subsections.description: The entity identifies, selects, and develops risk mitigation activities for risks arising from potential business disruptions.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Management
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a risk management program to identify, prioritize, and mitigate risk to acceptable levels.

programControlMapping.name: Business Continuity / Disaster Recovery Program
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Business Continuity Policy and Plan which outlines the requirements and a process to recover from prolonged disruptions of business operations.

programControlMapping.name: Cyber Insurance
programControlMapping.description: The company has cyber insurance to mitigate the risk of financial impact from from security incidents.

programControlMapping.name: Disaster Recovery Testing
programControlMapping.description: A disaster recovery test with predefined RTO goals is performed annually, assuming a full outage of our primary cloud region.

programControlMapping.name: Risk Register
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Cumulative Risk Register storing control deficiencies identified as part of ongoing system reviews, and reviews the register as part of the company's regular Risk Assessment process.

subsections.description: The entity assesses and manages risks associated with vendors and business partners.

programControlMapping.name: Vendor risk assessment
programControlMapping.description: As part of the risk management process, vendors storing data classified as Customer Sensitive undergo due diligence and risk assessment.

programControlMapping.name: Vendor Monitoring
programControlMapping.description: Vendors are evaluated on a periodic basis, by reviewing their audit reports or other means, in order to track and determine the impact of any changes in their security posture.

programControlMapping.name: Inventory and classification
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains an inventory of its vendors and classification of the data they store or process.

programControlMapping.name: Vendor Agreements
programControlMapping.description: Agreements with third-party services that handle Customer Sensitive data include requirements and expectations regarding data confidentiality and the vendor's security responsibilities

programPolicyMapping.title: Business Continuity Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish requirements and plans to recover company operations following a disruption due to causes such as natural disaster, loss of access to premises, pandemic, or malicious activity from external or internal sources.

programPolicyMapping.title: Backup Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Describe controls that are necessary to mitigate the accidental loss of data by maintaining backups.

programPolicyMapping.title: Information Security Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish an Information Security Program which protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the company's data and assets.

programPolicyMapping.title: Vendor Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the scope and objectives for the selection, acquisition, and management of products and services from third-party vendors, in order to maintain the security of the company's information assets that are accessible by those vendors

programPolicyMapping.title: Risk Management Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish a framework for managing risk at the company and incorporating risk assessments throughout the company's operations.

subsections.description: The entity maintains, monitors, and evaluates current processing capacity and use of system components (infrastructure, data, and software) to manage capacity demand and to enable the implementation of additional capacity to help meet its objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Performance monitoring
programControlMapping.description: The company uses performance monitoring tools to track the performance of its applications and identify potential issues.

programControlMapping.name: Capacity Planning
programControlMapping.description: The company performs capacity planning to ensure that sufficient capacity is available to handle the forecasted demand and workloads of its customers.

programControlMapping.name: Usage monitoring
programControlMapping.description: The company leverages utilization monitoring tools to track the utilization of its systems and identify overloaded and under-provisioned resources.

subsections.description: The entity authorizes, designs, develops or acquires, implements, operates, approves, maintains, and monitors environmental protections, software, data back-up processes, and recovery infrastructure to meet its objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Datacenters
programControlMapping.description: The company uses established Infrastructure-as-a-Service cloud providers to procure the necessary infrastructure required to meet the business objectives. The cloud vendor(s) provide and manage best-in-class Data Centers, including Asset Management, Redundant Power and Networks, and Physical Security. The company has security controls to govern its obligations as part of the shared responsibility model required by the cloud provider.

programControlMapping.name: Business Continuity / Disaster Recovery Program
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Business Continuity Policy and Plan which outlines the requirements and a process to recover from prolonged disruptions of business operations.

programControlMapping.name: Backup Plan
programControlMapping.description: Customer data is automatically backed up according to a backup configuration scheduled described in the Backup Procedure.

programControlMapping.name: Backup Storage
programControlMapping.description: Backups are encrypted, stored in geographically independent regions, and have equivalent access control to the original system.

programControlMapping.name: Disaster Recovery Testing
programControlMapping.description: A disaster recovery test with predefined RTO goals is performed annually, assuming a full outage of our primary cloud region.

programControlMapping.name: Backup System Monitoring
programControlMapping.description: The data backup process generates alert notifications in case of a backup job failure.

programControlMapping.name: Fault Tolerance
programControlMapping.description: Critical system components are architected for fault-tolerance and leverage cloud provider features such as availability zones, automatic scaling, and built-in failover.

subsections.description: The entity tests recovery plan procedures supporting system recovery to meet its objectives.

programControlMapping.name: Restore Testing
programControlMapping.description: Backup restore tests are performed at least quarterly and ensure that the restored system works end-to-end.

programControlMapping.name: Backup Storage
programControlMapping.description: Backups are encrypted, stored in geographically independent regions, and have equivalent access control to the original system.

programControlMapping.name: Business Continuity / Disaster Recovery Program
programControlMapping.description: The company maintains a Business Continuity Policy and Plan which outlines the requirements and a process to recover from prolonged disruptions of business operations.

programControlMapping.name: Backup Retention
programControlMapping.description: Backup retention is governed by customer agreements, and business, legal and regulatory requirements.

programPolicyMapping.title: Business Continuity Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish requirements and plans to recover company operations following a disruption due to causes such as natural disaster, loss of access to premises, pandemic, or malicious activity from external or internal sources.

programPolicyMapping.title: Backup Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Describe controls that are necessary to mitigate the accidental loss of data by maintaining backups.

programPolicyMapping.title: Physical Security Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Establish the requirements and process for controlling access to company facilities and requirements for data centers hosting company system components.

programPolicyMapping.title: Data Classification Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Define a data classification framework that can be used to determine the sensitivity of data and systems.

subsections.description: The entity identifies and maintains confidential information to meet the entity’s objectives related to confidentiality.

programControlMapping.name: File store encryption
programControlMapping.description: Third-party cloud filestores such as S3 and GCS are configured with a minimum server-side encryption using the vendor's key.

programControlMapping.name: Data Retention
programControlMapping.description: Retention periods for customer data are specified in the company's Data Retention Procedure and adhere to compliance, regulatory, contractual, and organizational requirements.

programControlMapping.name: File systems encryption
programControlMapping.description: File systems for databases and other sensitive data storage require at least block level encryption.

programControlMapping.name: Vendor Agreements
programControlMapping.description: Agreements with third-party services that handle Customer Sensitive data include requirements and expectations regarding data confidentiality and the vendor's security responsibilities

programControlMapping.name: Confidentiality agreement
programControlMapping.description: All employees and full time contractors must sign a confidentiality agreement with the company prior to gaining access to any sensitive information.

programControlMapping.name: Data in transit encryption
programControlMapping.description: Data in transit over the public Internet is encrypted with industry-standard algorithms.

programControlMapping.name: Data store encryption
programControlMapping.description: Data stores are configured to enable encryption at rest.

subsections.description: The entity disposes of confidential information to meet the entity’s objectives related to confidentiality.

programControlMapping.name: Data Disposal
programControlMapping.description: Customer data is securely disposed of after its retention period passes, and any retained data is sanitized and anonymized.

programControlMapping.name: Backup Retention
programControlMapping.description: Backup retention is governed by customer agreements, and business, legal and regulatory requirements.

programControlMapping.name: Asset Disposal
programControlMapping.description: A process is in place to track and properly dispose of IT assets that have reached their end of life.

programPolicyMapping.title: Backup Policy
programPolicyMapping.description: Describe controls that are necessary to mitigate the accidental loss of data by maintaining backups.

programPolicyMapping.title: Encryption Policy
